They just can't use the black-bean teaching.
It's difficult to bear the burden of the true teaching.
He was about to rescue the Buddha's teachings.
At this point, it's flat and sunken.
It's painful!
He took a moment to say.
"Song Yuan Laozi.
"Suppressing Ryō is cheap.
If he had used the black soybean syllogism.
What's so special about it?
You must cut the lasso and put it through the nose of the Buddha and ancestors from above.
He must put it through the nostrils of the Buddha from above.
Only then will he have a free hand.
A priest then said.
"The cord of severing the kernels.
Couldn't it be in the monk's hand?
The master said.
"This blind man!
He took the staff and beat him.

source_sentence: 呆庵莊禪師語錄卷之四
translation: Duananzhuang chanshi yulu, vol. 4
